articles.title: Title of DPRK Hero Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Title of DPRK Hero Awarded to Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The title of the DPRK Hero was awarded to Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Kim Jong Il performed undying revolutionary feats for the country and its people, the times and history by wisely leading the WPK, army and people for decades since he embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years.
					
					 He developed in depth the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung with his clairvoyant wisdom and energetic ideological and theoretical activities, thus glorifying them as an encyclopedic ideological and theoretical boon indicating the road to be followed by the WPK, revolution and the era of independence. He gave a steady continuity to the tradition of the Korean revolution by upholding and carrying forward the revolutionary tradition of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 He developed the WPK, army and state bequeathed by the President into his party, army and state shining with his immortal name and placed the country's dignity and power onto the highest level in the history of the Korean nation spanning five thousand years.
					
					 True to the last instructions of the President for national reunification, Kim Jong Il led all the fellow countrymen along the road of independence and great national unity, ushered in the June 15 era of reunification advancing in the spirit of "By our nation itself" and made a great contribution to achieving the victory of the socialist cause and accomplishing the just cause of the world peace and stability and friendship and solidarity among peoples under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism.
					
					 He devoted all his efforts and wisdom and energies for building  a thriving nation and improving the standard of people's living, regarding the idea of believing in the people as in Heaven as his maxim in the whole period of his revolutionary activities. He breathed his last at work on a train due to manifold mental and physical strain while making the most arduous forced march for field guidance without having any good rest.
					
					 A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the title of the DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il was promulgated on Dec. 19.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors Accused of Thrice-cursed Crimes
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors Accused of Thrice-cursed Crimes

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea Friday released the following statement:
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK lost the father of their large family on December 17 so suddenly and so early to their regret.
					
					 Their sorrow over the loss was so bitter and unbearable that the whole country turned into a veritable sea of mourners and even the mountains, rivers, plants and trees seemed to wail. 
					
					 This is because leader Kim Jong Il was the great leader recognized by the world, iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated even the formidable enemies and tender-hearted father who brought up the servicepersons and people under his loving care.
					
					 Now not only the Korean people but the whole world will more keenly realize as the days go by what great and distinguished man they lost.
					
					 We feel grateful to the heads of state and party leaders, governments, organizations and personages of many countries of the world and compatriots at home and abroad for expressing profound condolences, sharing sorrow with us, and sending sincere sympathy and encouragement during the mourning period. We will never forget them.
					
					 When the whole nation is overcome with grief over the great loss, only the south Korean puppet group committed thrice-cursed crimes.
					
					 The DPRK National Defence Commission, above all, discloses before the world and the nation the truth about those crimes of the south Korean puppet group.
					
					 Though the country remains divided into the north and the south due to foreign forces, we are one nation. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK, though suffering pain resulting from the division, have valued this homogenous nation more than anything else, always regarding as their faith the truth that the nation is above the ideology and system.
					
					 But this time the south Korean puppet group perpetrated such rash act as hurting the grief-stricken compatriots and rubbing salt into their wounds, determined to stop remaining as part of the nation of its own accord.
					
					 No sooner had the important report of the DPRK been released than the south Korean puppet group convened an emergency "state security meeting" and "state affairs meeting" and put even overseas missions on emergency alert duty, kicking off rackets to create the impression that a "contingency" was created as expected, and a "golden opportunity" presented itself to lead the north to "system change". 
					
					 The south Korean authorities put the three services of the puppet army on an emergency alert and ordered them to adopt combat posture, creating a war-like atmosphere on the ground and in the seas and air. They let over 30 right-wing conservative reactionary organizations flock to the forefront areas to scatter anti-DPRK leaflets whose content was hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and inciting disturbance. 
					
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak spearheaded all these operations. 
					
					 He sought to attain his foolish goal by taking the advantage of the mourning period, and if that fails, to lead the DPRK to "contingency" and "change of system". 
					
					 From the olden times, it was considered inhumane to raise one's fist at the neighbor visited by misfortune and seek profits.
					
					 Even a foreign country which has no diplomatic relations with the DPRK stopped the planned military exercises being considerate of the sorrow of the army and people of the DPRK and set a mourning period to express condolences. In the light of this, the traitorous group's bullying acts can not but be viewed as one defying human ethics and morality. 
					
					 Lee group's stepped-up show of enmity toward the DPRK culminated in its act of blocking south Koreans who wanted to visit Pyongyang to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 South Koreans from all walks of life upon the news of Kim Jong Il's demise that came like a bolt from the blue strongly called for expressing condolences and dispatching mourners group regardless of whether they belonged to progressive or conservative camps and ruling or opposition parties. 
					
					 The traitorous group of Lee turned down all the demands and described the south Korean people's request to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il as "sympathy to citizens separated from the north regime". It banned the dispatch of mourners' group talking about "chaos of south Korean society". It foolishly tried to estrange the popular masses of the DPRK from its headquarters on one hand and totally ban the Pyongyang visits much hoped by broad south Koreans by taking the measures of "selected visits" and "restricting mourners groups" on the other hand. 
					
					 Shared sorrow lessens while shared pleasure increases. 
					
					 Expressing condolences and sending condolatory messages have been good manners and customs and ethical tradition peculiar to the Korean nation from the ancient times. 
					
					 It is for this reason that we brand the evil act of the Lee group as treason bereft of elementary human reason and morality. 
					
					 The group dared try to link the "final responsibility" for the warship "Cheonan" sinking and shelling on Yonphyong Island with the supreme leadership of the DPRK. They let loose such reckless remarks that the DPRK must present justifications for south Korea to move if it wants to have the "May 24 measure of the authorities" retracted and the north-south relations mended this time. 
					
					 It is hideous crime that can never be pardoned in any case to dare hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK over its army's self-defensive shell-firing on Yonphyong Island for coping with preemptive provocation in the wake of the "Cheonan" warship sinking case which is not related to the DPRK.
					
					 The group of traitors even hatched a plot to prompt the DPRK make a "change", while talking about its non-existent "contingency" and "instability" of its dignified system and regime. This evildoing adds to the said crimes.
					
					 Upon joint authorization of the Party, state, army and people of the DPRK, the DPRK National Defence Commission clarifies the following principled stand on the group of traitors' hideous crimes committed at the time of the great misfortune of the nation:
					
					 As already declared, the DPRK will have no dealings with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors forever.
					
					 To company with them is a disgrace for the clear and honest-minded Korean nation as they are ignorant in politics, vulgar in morals and lack elementary human nature.
					
					 We will surely force the group of traitors to pay for its hideous crimes committed at the time of the great national misfortune.
					
					 The veritable sea of tears shed by the army and people of the DPRK will turn into that of retaliatory fire to burn all the group of traitors to the last one and their wailing into a roar of revenge to smash the stronghold of the puppet forces.
					
					 The conservative media of south Korea would also face due punishment as they are backing and following the group of traitors in its treacherous act against humanity through false report, fabrication, speculation and presumption, oblivious of their mission to be fair speaker for the public and pioneer of true public.
					
					 The south Korean puppets and world reactionaries should no longer make a fool of themselves in their bid to lead the DPRK to "contingency" and make its "system instable", something unimaginable.
					
					All the soldiers and people of the DPRK turned out to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il since the announcement of his demise, an indication of the great unity of the party, army and people behind the headquarters of the revolution in single mind and invincibility of the Korean-style socialist system.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will unswervingly keep to the path of Juche indicated by Kim Jong Il true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Taking this opportunity, we solemnly declare with confidence that the south Korean puppets and foolish politicians around the world should not expect any change from the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will keep to the path of improving north-south relations and achieving peace and prosperity.
					
					 Mended north-south relations we want are not improvement based on "high-handedness" and "flexibility" as touted by Lee Myung Bak group of traitors or on crafty gimmick of those rhetorics.
					
					 The DPRK wants to improve relations with the south and bring peace and prosperity through the nationwide drive to implement the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration under the banner of independence, peace and reunification.
					
					 The world will see how the army and people of the DPRK win the final victory after turning their sorrow and tears into strength and courage, closely rallied behind the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: KCNA Detailed Report on Mourning Period for Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
KCNA Detailed Report on Mourning Period for Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency released a detailed report Thursday on the past 11 days when the nation mourned the death of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The report says: 
					
					 At noon on last Monday when the news that Kim Jong Il passed away on a running train was released, the whole country and all the fellow countrymen were wrapped in an indescribable sorrow. 
					
					 A total of 260 million soldiers, people and school youth and children turned out to pay respects to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An endless stream of servicepersons and people visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung, revolutionary sites, monuments and mosaics telling about the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Jong Il in different parts of the country.
					
					 From noon on Dec. 19 to noon the next day a total of more than 5 million crowds visited the President's statues in Pyongyang.
					
					 For two days after the announcement of Kim Jong Il's demise, at least 43.92 million people visited mourning stations across the country where they left wreaths, bouquets or flowers, mourning the death of the leader in bitter grief.
					
					 A mass crowd converged on mourning centers where huge portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il were set up and adjacent roads and regions across the country, typically Kim Il Sung Square, the plazas of the April 25 House of Culture, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, Pyongyang Indoor Stadium in Pyongyang in the whole mourning period.
					
					 People residing in cities and counties traveled some 40 km to their provincial seats to pay respects to the portraits of the smiling leader.
					
					 Wreaths placed before mourning stations in Pyongyang alone number more than 400,000.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of our party and people, led the procession of leading party, state and armed forces officials several times in paying respects to Kim Jong Il lying in state in the Kumsusan Memorial Palace. He also stood guard when he greeted soldiers, Pyongyang citizens and representatives from local areas who came to the palace to mourn the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 More than 50 000 officials, servicepersons and people from all walks of life poured into the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay respects to Kim Jong Il during the period.
					
					 Those officials, working people and school youth and children who stood guards in outdoor mourning centers increased throughout days.
					
					 Fish which Kim Jong Il had been concerned about their supply just the day before he passed away have been supplied to Pyongyang citizens overcome with sorrow.
					
					 At least 30,000 service stands, more than 10,000 medical posts have been set up across the country where hot soy bean milk, honeyed water, pine needle tea, barley tea and sugared water had been served and mobile medical operations have been active across the country.
					
					 Makeshift buildings have been set up and "buses for warming mourners" went on standby here and there.
					
					 Strange natural phenomena have been witnessed with a cracking of a sheet of ice on Lake Chon of Mt. Paektu with a loud roar on the morning of Dec. 17 and mysterious glow over Hyangdo Peak and Jong Il Peak on Dec. 19 and 20. 
					
					 Lightning was witnessed in the snowy sky followed by roaring thunder in Kaesong City. Clouds of Mt. Paektu shape appeared in the sky above Hoeryong City and many other spectacular natural phenomena have been observed in other places.
					
					 The army and people rose up, turning the greatest sorrow of the nation into thousand-fold strength and courage. 
					
					 Officials and working people across the country had requested in unison to erect the statue of Kim Jong Il before anything else. 
					
					 At least 380 poems and lyrics have been created during the mourning period.
					
					 Some 1.2 million young people volunteered to serve the army taking the country as a whole.
					
					 About 3 million members of working people's organizations formed more than 10,000 shock brigades and went to the Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station, Mansudae area construction site and Komdok Mining Complex and other places alive with high-pitched drive for a great surge.
					
					 Unprecedented innovations have been witnessed in factories, enterprises, co-op farms and scientific and educational institutions across the country.
					
					 The eruption of loyalty has been culminated in the national funeral in which people lined up along snow-covered 40-odd km routes in Pyongyang despite freezing cold to bid last farewell to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 People vied with each other to take off clothes and mufflers to cover the roads, saying they can not let the hearse for Kim Jong Il pass snow-covered roads. Dramatic scenes were seen as weepers circled the hearse in a desperate bid to stop it from passing by. They cried: General, you can not go leaving the people behind.
					
					 There was a national memorial service for Kim Jong Il on Thursday. Similar events were held in provinces, cities and counties. 
					
					 21-gun salutes boomed for Kim Jong Il and locomotives and vessels and all units with sirens blew whistles all at once and all the people observed a three-minutes silence to pay their respects to him. 
					
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly awarded the title of the DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il reflecting the unanimous wishes of all the soldiers and people. 
					
					 Following the announcement of Kim Jong Il's demise, south Koreans opened Internet homepages and posted articles reflecting their grief. Many hang portraits of Kim Jong Il and placed wreaths and flowers before them. 
					
					 Lots of reunification movement organizations, civic, public and religious organizations issued condolence statements and sent condolatory messages.
					
					 Civilian level organizations formed mourners groups and clarified their willingness to send mourners groups as part of their active operation to visit the bier of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Figures of all social standings and people in Seoul, Kwangju, Jonju, Taejon and all other places of south Korea strongly called for making condolatory visits and voices calling for sending a "government"-level condolatory group were also heard even from politicians. 
					
					 Ri Hui Ho, widow of Kim Dae Jung, ex-president of south Korea, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, came to Pyongyang to pay respects to the bier of Kim Jong Il. Hwang Hye Ro, co-representative of the Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy, also came to Pyongyang to pay respects to Kim Jong Il.
					
					  South Korean media gave broad publicity to the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man and devoted many programs to the news of the grief of fellow countrymen.
					
					 The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan presented a condolence message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un and lots of mourners delegations came to the homeland carrying the feelings of the Koreans in Japan.  Mourning ceremonies took place in Japan wherever Koreans resided.
					
					 Koreans in China and Russia visited the mourning centers arranged in the DPRK embassies, the consulates general and consular offices   in China and Russia.
					
					 Koreans residing in China, Russia, Uzbekistan, France, the U.S. and all other places of the world paid respects to Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence.
					
					 Scores of overseas Koreans' delegations also visited Pyongyang during the period.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mourners Delegation of Chongryon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Mourners Delegation of Chongryon

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk in a compatriotic atmosphere with the mourners delegation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan led by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the its Central Standing Committee, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday. 
					
					 At the talk Nam Sung U said that the untimely demise of leader Kim Jong Il is the greatest loss to our nation.
					
					 Officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan will turn sorrow into thousand-fold strength and courage and develop Chongryon true to the intention of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed his firm will to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem forever and remain loyal to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

					 He said:
					
					 I had an honor of receiving precious instructions from such the greatest man as Kim Jong Il. I deem it as the greatest honor and happiness in my life.
					
					 I am sure that though he passed away, the Korean people will surely overcome the present difficulties as there is  the  dear respected Kim Jong Un identical to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Swedish Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Swedish Party Leader Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Anders Karlsson, chairman of the Communist Party of Sweden, together with his wife paid a condolatory visit to the DPRK embassy in Stockholm on Tuesday on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They laid a bouquet before the portrait of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The chairman made an entry in the mourners' book. 
					
					 He said:
					
					 There will be no change in the DPRK as the revolutionary cause started by President Kim Il Sung and successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il is deeply cherished in the minds of the members of the Workers' Party of Korea and other people.
					
					 Kim Jong Il paid heed to the voices of the people, always finding himself among them in his lifetime.
					
					 I am convinced that the dear respected Kim Jong Un who has fully personified the political mode and leadership traits of Kim Jong Il will lead the socialist cause and the cause of building a thriving nation along the road of victory, enjoying the undisputed trust of all the members of the WPK and other people.

Tanzanian Figure Visits DPRK Embassy

					 Authorized by the president, the minister of State for the Vice-President Office visited the DPRK mission in Dar Es Salaam on the same day and paid a silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The minister said he hoped that the friendly Korean government and people would overcome the sorrow as soon as possible and display strength and courage to gain successes in the efforts to realize the desire of Kim Jong Il under the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Cuban People Visit DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Cuban People Visit DPRK Embassy

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- More than 300 personages of Cuba from army, public and friendship organizations, institutions and fields of education, media, culture and arts paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Havana on Dec. 23 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were the vice-chairman of the Munitions Complex of the Ministry of the Revolutionary Armed Forces, the director of Kim Il Sung High School, the chairman of the Federation of University Students and the deputy manager of the Cuba-Korea Friendship Poultry Breeding Farm.
					
					 The visitors paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il after placing bouquets and flowers before his portrait. 
					
					 Expressing their deep condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, they stressed that his idea and exploits would remain long in the hearts of the Cuban people. 
					
					 They hoped the army and people of the DPRK would achieve bigger successes in socialist construction and the cause of national reunification, closely untied around the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 On the same day ambassadors and charges d'affaires ad interim of Russia, Laos, Syria, Indonesia, Congo, Namibia, Ethiopia, Mali, Burkina Faso, Guinea, Equatorial Guinea, Zimbabwe, Grenada, Peru, Bolivia, Brazil and Romania to Cuba paid condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy.

articles.title: Foreign Organizations and Figures Visit DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Foreign Organizations and Figures Visit DPRK Embassies

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Personages of Britain visited the DPRK embassy in London on December 20 to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the chairman of the C.C., Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the spokesman (leader) of the C.C., Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) and the general secretary of C.C., New Communist Party of Britain and members of its leadership.
					
					 A delegation of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola led by the director of its International Department and many personages of Angola visited the DPRK mission in Luanda and mourning stations set up at offices of DPRK delegations on Dec. 23 to express condolences.
					
					 The DPRK embassy in Katmandu was visited on Dec. 26 by chairmen of the central committees of the Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), the Communist Party (Marxist-Lenin-Socialism), the Communist Party (United) and the Congress Party of Nepal and the leader of the Congress Party who was former prime minister.
					
					 On the same days condolatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Damascus were paid by at least 60 personages of Syria, including the minister of Culture, the general secretary of the Al Ahd al Watani Party, the general secretary of the Arab Socialist Union Party, the deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces and the president of the Trade Unions Federation, and ambassadors and charges d'affaires a.i. of India, Sudan, South Africa, Yemen, Norway, Bulgaria, Venezuela and Brazil to Syria.
					
					 Personages of governments, parliaments, political parties, organizations and institutions in Italy, Bulgaria, South Africa, Mexico and Libya and the secretary generals of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and the African Taekwon-Do Federation paid condolatory visits to DPRK missions between Dec. 20 and 23.
					
					 They laid wreaths and bouquets before the portraits of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences.

articles.title: Russian Personages Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Russian Personages Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Russian personages visited DPRK missions in Russia to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il from Dec. 20 to 26. 
					
					 Among them were officials of the Supreme Court, the General Department of the International Military Cooperation of the Ministry of Defense, Agency for Support and Coordination of Russian Participation in International Humanitarian Operations of the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation, Russian Aerial Transport Administration, Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Sciences, mission of the Foreign Ministry in Vladivostok, Administration of Maritime Territory, Nakhodka City Administration, Khabarovsk City Administration, Young Communist League, Interior Bureau of Nakhodka City, Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, Far Eastern State University, Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory, Tynda City Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of the Russian Philosophy Association, Russia-Korea Children's Friendship Association Named after Kim Jong Il of 11th Middle School in Khabarovsk City, Gazprom and the Russian Railways Company. 
					
					 The visitors laid wreaths, floral baskets and flowers before portraits of Kim Jong Il and expressed deep condolences. 
					
					 They made entries in the mourners' book. 
					
					 Vice-President of the Supreme Court Nechyaev wrote that Kim Jong Il conducted energetic external activities for peace and justice in the world and friendship and solidarity between the Russian Federation and the DPRK. 
					
					 Neradiko Alexandr, director of the Russian Aerial Transport Administration, expressed belief that the Korean people would overcome pain and sorrow over the loss to the nation and confidently advance along the right way of victory under the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Meanwhile, the family of internationalist soldier Ya. T. Nobichenko visited a construction company of the DPRK in Novosibirsk and laid a floral basket before the portrait of Kim Jong Il to express condolences.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomatic Envoys Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomatic Envoys Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries to South Africa, Cuba, Peru, Ethiopia, Libya, Mexico and Brazil and foreign diplomatic envoys to the United Nations paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries and the DPRK permanent mission to the UN between Dec. 25 and 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The visitors paid a silent tribute to the memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Chinese ambassador to South Africa said that Kim Jong Il, the closest friend of the Chinese people, would live forever.
					
					 The Tanzanian ambassador to Ethiopia wrote in the condolence book: 
					
					 A great statesman has passed away. On behalf of the government and the president of Tanzania I express condolences on the demise of the great leader.

articles.title: Delegations and Representatives of Ministries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Delegations and Representatives of Ministries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) --The delegations and representatives of ministries, institutions and organizations of different countries and the United Nations organization paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in respective countries between Dec. 23 and Dec. 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were delegations of the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications, the Ministry of Water Recourses and Weather and the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports of Cambodia, the Ministry of Health of Mozambique and the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche, representatives of the Foreign Ministry of Kuwait, the Foreign Ministry of Romania, the National Defence Commission of Federal Parliament of Austria and the Asia and Pacific Regional Office of UNESCO.
					
					 They presented wreaths, bouquets and flowers before portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute to him.
					
					 The Austrian Federal Ministry of Europe and International Relations sent a condolatory note to the DPRK mission in Vienna on Dec. 27.

articles.title: Organizations and Figures of Different Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Organizations and Figures of Different Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations and personages of various countries paid condolatory visits to DPRK missions between Dec. 23 and 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were the deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Jilin Provincial People's Government and the director of the Center for Korean Peninsula Studies at the Liaoning Academy of Social Sciences of China; representatives of the Maritime Territorial Regional Bank Committee, the Development and Investment Financial Company and the Vladivostok Taekwon-do Federation of Russia; the editor-in-chief of the Public News of India; the chairman of the Islamic Revolutionary Proletarian Organization, the director-general for International Relations of the Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee and the director-general for Asia-Oceanic Affairs of the Ministry of Oil of Iran; the general secretary of the Party for Thailand; the chairman of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association; the chairman of the Finland-Korea Society; the chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy; the chairperson of the Luxembourg-Korea Friendship Association
					
					 ; the director of Protocol of the Foreign Ministry of Romania; the acting director for Asia-Pacific Affairs of the Foreign Ministry of the Czech Republic, the chairman of the C.C., Czech, Moravian, Silesian Trade Unions' Association and the chairman of the Prague City Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia; the chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea  in Conakry and the vice-chairman of the Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea of Guinea; the chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea; the deputy commander of Air Force of the People's Defense Forces, the director for Asia-Pacific Affairs of the Foreign Ministry and the permanent secretary of the prime minister's office of Uganda; and the vice minister of the Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Tanzania.
					
					 They laid wreaths, floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid a silent tribute to him.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries to the Czech Republic, Sweden, Nepal, Bangladesh, Laos, Iran, India, Myanmar, Democratic Congo, Libya and Guinea paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in those countries between Dec. 21 and 27 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They observed a moment's silence in memory of the leader.
					
					 The Chinese ambassador to the Czech Republic said: We express our deep condolences on the passing of Comrade Kim Jong Il. The Chinese people will always stand by the side of the Korean people.
					
					 The Russian ambassador to Nepal said that the Russian people know well how great pain and loss Kim Jong Il's demise is to the Korean people.
					
					 The Cuban ambassador to Sweden wrote in the mourners' book that the Cuban people would always remember the support and solidarity he rendered to the Cuban revolution.

articles.title: Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Personages of Various Countries Visit DPRK Missions

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Personages of various circles of different countries paid condolatory visits to the DPRK missions in their respective countries on Dec. 26 and 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Among them were the vice-chairman of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces who doubles as the commander of the AA Defense Forces, the vice-minister for Protocol of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the secretary of the President's Office of Egypt, the information director-general of the Ministry of Information and the chief of the Group for the Study of Kimjongilism of Guinea, the permanent secretary of the Ministry of Justice of Uganda, the chief of staff of the Defence Forces and police inspector general of Rwanda, the director of the  Investment Promotion Department of the Investment Promotion Committee and the assistant to the director of the Protocol Department of the Ministry of Sports of Nigeria, the secretary general of the Sunbula International Friendship Club of Libya and the acting special assistant to the Brazilian president for international affairs.
					
					 They presented wreaths, floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of Kim Jong Il and paid silent tribute.
					
					 They expressed profound condolences over the demise of Kim Jong Il and praised him as a distinguished great man in the present age who devoted his life to building a thriving nation and defending socialism.

articles.title: WPF Mourners Group Leaves
articles.content:
WPF Mourners Group Leaves

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The mourners group of the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin left Pyongyang Friday after visiting it to express deep condolences on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Mourners Go Back Home
articles.content:
Chinese Mourners Go Back Home

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Families of Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle left for home on Friday.
					
					 They included families of Zhou Baozhong's daughter Zhou Wei and Feng Zhongyun and Chai Shiying's great-grandson Chai Long.

articles.title: Party Given for Mourners from China
articles.content:
Party Given for Mourners from China

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, arranged a reception to comfort those who came here from China to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the reception, which took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday, were the family of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and families of Chinese and Koreans related to anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and a Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter. They included families of Zhou Baozhong's daughter Zhou Wei, Feng Zhongyun, Shang Yue, Chen Lei and Hu Zhenyi, Chai Shiying's great-grandson Chai Long and Ri Jae Dok, and Ri Kwan Rin.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, said at the reception that though Kim Jong Un was in grief at the loss of Kim Jong Il, he showed such warm benevolence as arranging the reception for them.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, paramount incarnation of revolutionary moral obligation, showed warm loving care for the revolutionary comrades-in-arms with whom President Kim Il Sung had relationship during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and their bereaved families, always remembering them, the speaker noted.
					
					 This relationship between the peerlessly great men and those persons overseas would be steadily maintained by Kim Jong Un, he stressed.
					
					 Zhang Weihua's son Zhang Jinquan, Zhou Baozhong's daughter Zhou Wei and Feng Zhongyun's daughter Feng Yiluo said that              Kim Jong Il's whole life is a noble life dedicated to the people and his great feats would be immortal.
					
					 They pledged themselves to do their best to develop the traditional China-DPRK friendship with the Korean people true to the intention of Kim Jong Un by turning the present sorrow into strength and courage.

articles.title: Governor of Amur Region of Russia Recollects Personality of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Governor of Amur Region of Russia Recollects Personality of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Amur Region of Russia, recollected with deep emotion the personality  of leader Kim Jong Il as a great man, according to a Ria-Novosti news report of Russia on December 20.
					
					 The governor paid a condolatory visit to a DPRK construction company in Blagobeshensk City to express deep condolences on the demise of Kim Jong Il, the report said, adding:
					
					 Kozhemyako is the only regional governor in Russia who had the honor of being received by Kim Jong Il several times.
					
					 Kim Jong Il received the governor in the DPRK in October this year, too.
					
					 Recalling Kim Jong Il, the governor posted on an Internet website the following article:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il was an unworldly-minded, all-round, kind and careful man. 
					
					 He talked about all problems of society and cracked a lot of joke.
					
					 I even bet with him in jest.
					
					 He was deeply versed in the Russian people's tradition of culture.
					
					 In October this year, the Amur regional delegation was accorded very warm and sincere hospitality in the DPRK. All of us never forget that time.

articles.title: Title of DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il Represents Korean People's Wish
articles.content:
Title of DPRK Hero to Kim Jong Il Represents Korean People's Wish

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- A December 19 decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly on awarding the title of Hero of the DPRK to leader Kim Jong Il was published Friday.
					
					 Kim Jong Il performed undying revolutionary feats for the country and its people, the times and history by wisely leading the Workers' Party of Korea, army and people for decades. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il, infinitely faithful to the revolutionary cause pioneered by President Kim Il Sung, developed the Juche idea, the Songun (military-first) idea founded by the President with his clairvoyant acumen and energetic ideological and theoretical activities, thus indicating the road to be followed by the era of independence.
					
					 By pursuing unique Songun-based politics, he foiled the imperialists' persistent moves to stifle the DPRK, creditably defending socialist Korea. He also turned the DPRK into an ideological and political power and a military power with nuclear deterrent, which any enemy dares not provoke.
					
					 With an unshakable will to build a thriving socialist nation as desired by the President, he guided the revolution and construction to effect a revolutionary upsurge throughout the country.
					
					 This year, too, he gave field guidance to many army units and economic sectors to significantly greet the President's centennial birth anniversary (April 15, 2012). His field guidance tour continued until the last days of his great life.
					
					 Thanks to his tireless efforts, the nation's economy has developed rapidly on the IT basis.
					
					 Many modern industrial establishments have been built throughout the country to lay solid foundations for the improvement of the people's living standard.
					
					 The Korean people, who have suffered the nation's biggest loss in the closing days of the year, are paying their highest respects to Kim Jong Il for his patriotic, revolutionary life devoted to them.
					
					 He was awarded the titles of DPRK Hero in February 1975, February 1982 and February 1992.

articles.title: Servicepersons Vow to Settle Accounts with S. Korea for Crimes
articles.content:
Servicepersons Vow to Settle Accounts with S. Korea for Crimes

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Upon receiving a statement released by the DPRK National Defence Commission (NDC) on Friday, servicepersons have renewed their resolve to settle accounts with the south Korean regime for the crimes it committed during the mourning period in the DPRK.
					
					 Jong Il Nam, an officer of the Korean People's Army (KPA), told KCNA that it is amply justifiable that the NDC stated the DPRK would have no dealings with the Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 "The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is our sworn enemy as it hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and talked about 'contingency in the north after driving the relations between the north and the south of Korea to catastrophe," he said, adding:
					
					 "The KPA soldiers are determined to turn the sea of tears shed by the Korean people for the nation's greatest loss into that of retaliatory fire to punish the traitors for their crimes."
					
					 A servicewoman, Han Myong Ok, said, "There is no rival in the world to the KPA which has become an invincible revolutionary army under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, illustrious commander, and to our people fully prepared to devotedly defend the socialist system."

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Heinous Crime Touches Off Fury in DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Heinous Crime Touches Off Fury in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK National Defence Commission released a statement Friday, strongly denouncing the south Korean regime for having committed heinous crimes against the fellow countrymen in the north when they were suffering the great misfortune.
					
					 Upon hearing the statement, Choe Hak Su, a workshop head of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am incensed by the crimes the south Korean regime committed against the fellow countrymen in the north when they were in deep grief.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime has wrecked the relations between the north and the south of Korea and spoiled the atmosphere of reconciliation and cooperation, seeking confrontation with the north. To make matters worse, it had impudence to hurt our dignity and social system again. 
					
					 Its hysterical deed is proper to those bereft of morality. 
					
					 The Lee regime should get a clear understanding of the strong will of our army and people closely rallied around our leadership and stop running amuck."
					
					 Ha Yong Chol, 50, a peasant of the Ryongsan Co-op Farm in Ryokpho District, Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "We can never pardon the Lee Myung Bak regime antagonizing our ideology and social system and seeking confrontation with the north. We agricultural workers will work hard to bring about an upsurge in agricultural production in the spirit of wiping out the group of traitors. We will turn out in annihilating all of them when an opportunity presents itself."

articles.title: Koreans Resolve to Annihilate Foes of Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans Resolve to Annihilate Foes of Reunification

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK National Defence Commission released a statement Friday, accusing the south Korean regime of its crimes committed against the fellow countrymen in the north, seized with grief at the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Upon receiving the statement, an officer of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF), Cha Paek Yong, told KCNA:
					
					 "The statement has kindled bitter resentment at the south Korean regime among all the KPISF officers and soldiers. 
					
					 We have kept a close eye on the crimes the traitor Lee Myung Bak has committed against the nation, reunification and the DPRK from the day when he came to power, and waited for an opportunity to punish him.
					
					 We can no longer remain an onlooker to his reckless acts. No mercy is available for such crimes."
					
					 A vice department director of the Ministry of Railways, Pak Yong Hwa, said:
					
					 "The Lee Myung Bak regime persistently seeking confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north is, indeed, a group of traitors to the nation. There is no need for us to have dealings with those ignorant of politics, vulgar in morality and mean in human nature.
					
					 We are ready to turn out in the struggle for annihilating the foes of peace and reunification and achieving national reunification."

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau issued new stamps carrying pictures of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Seen in the two sheets are inscriptions "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will live forever" and "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il will always be with us" respectively.
					
					 One of them contains a picture of Kim Jong Il with a broad smile on his face and pictures of Kimjongilia and magnolia blossoms.
					
					 The other sheet includes a picture of Kim Jong Il, together with the dear respected Kim Jong Un, in field guidance, against the background of Mt. Paektu, a holy mountain of revolution, tinged with glow.
					
					 The stamps reflect the life of Kim Jong Il, a peerless patriot and tender-hearted father of the people who lived with an ardent love and great devotion for the country and people.
					
					 They also show a strong will of all the Korean people to carry forward the cause of the Songun (military-first) revolution, the cause of the building of a thriving nation, upholding the leadership of Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Blocking Condolatory Visits to Pyongyang
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Blocking Condolatory Visits to Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Mourners group of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) made up of its elders set about a visit to Pyongyang on Wednesday to mourn the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The members of the group, including Ra Chang Sun, honorary chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, and Advisors Kang Sun Jong and Ri Chon Jae, left for Panmunjom, holding placards "We are making a journey to pay a condolatory visit in the spirit of June 15" and "How can the 'government' disallow consolatory visits and scatter leaflets?"
					
					 When they reached a checkpoint in Phaju City, Kyonggi Province,  puppet army soldiers and police blocked their way. 
					
					 Enraged by this, they offered strong resistance, shouting "We are on our way to Pyongyang to mourn the demise of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il. Step aside", "We are going to pave the way for promoting inter-Korean reconciliation through this visit. Why are you standing in our way?" 
					
					 The group's visit to Pyongyang could not take place due to the authorities' unethical action. 
					
					 They condemned the "government" for blocking the condolatory visit to mourn the demise of the supreme leader of the north as members of the same nation.

articles.title: Memorial Service of Koreans in Japan Held
articles.content:
Memorial Service of Koreans in Japan Held

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- A solemn memorial service of Koreans in Japan for leader Kim Jong Il took place at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo, Japan on December 29.
					
					 At least 10 000 men and women of all ages in Kanto packed the venue of the memorial service.
					
					 Attending the service were officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) including Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee who is vice-chairman of the Central Memorial Committee, members of the committee and compatriots.
					
					 All the participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ho Jong Man said in a mourning address that Kim Jong Il lived a life full of grim tempests of the times which no other great man of the world has ever experienced.
					
					 He noted that all the officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan would look up to Kim Jong Il as the immortal sun of the nation and benevolent teacher of Chongryon for all ages with unshakable faith and noble moral obligation.
					
					 He vowed that Chongryon would consolidate the single-minded unity of its ranks with the dear respected Kim Jong Un as the centre of unity and leadership.
					
					 The participants laid flowers before the portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence.
					
					 Solemn memorial services for Kim Jong Il also took place at the headquarters of Chongryon in Osaka, Hyogo, Kyoto, Hiroshima, Fukuoka and Hokkaido Prefectures on the same day.

articles.title: Cambodian Kingdom Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Cambodian Kingdom Mourns Demise of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- A national flag was hoisted at half-mast at the Royal Palace of Cambodia Wednesday to mourn the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: German Party issues Statement
articles.content:
German Party issues Statement

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Germany and the editorial department of its organ issued a joint statement on December 27 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The demise of Kim Jong Il, great son of Korea who remained faithful to the scientific outlook on the world and devoted his whole life to the accomplishment of the cause of socialism, is a great loss to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people and the whole progressive humankind, said the statement.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, the only successor to President Kim Il Sung, is an outstanding thinker and theoretician and great leader, it noted, adding:
					
					 By carrying forward the cause of Juche, the cause of Songun, he developed the DPRK in all fields and protected the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 Under his guidance, the DPRK achieved great economic and social successes.
					
					 In this hard period we express profound condolences to the WPK and all the Korean people overcoming the pain resulting from the greatest loss.
					
					 We are confident that the Korean people will achieve successes in building a thriving socialist nation and defending their country and extend sincere militant solidarity to them.

articles.title: Organizations of Ecuador Release Joint Statement
articles.content:
Organizations of Ecuador Release Joint Statement

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Ecuador released a joint statement on December 26 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They included the Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification, the Cultural Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Canar Provincial Institute for the Friendship and Solidarity with DPRK and the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People.
					
					 The statement said that the whole life of Kim Jong Il was that of a great leader who devoted all his heart and soul and energy to the happiness of the Korean people, national reunification and global independence.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Korean people would overcome the present great loss of the nation, firmly defend the dignity of the country and achieve greater successes in building a prosperous and powerful country, upholding the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un as desired by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, the Bulgarian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea also issued a joint statement on December 27.
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il will always live in our hearts as a great revolutionary and leader who clearly showed the road ahead of the progressive humankind, holding higher the red flag of the revolution in the grimmest period of world changes, the statement said.
					
					 It expressed firm belief that under the leadership of Kim Jong Un the Korean people would turn their sorrow into strength and accomplish to the last the revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung and carried forward by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Personages Issue Statements
articles.content:
Foreign Personages Issue Statements

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Personages of various countries issued statements on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Jose Armando Rodriguez, chairman of Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Mexico, in his statement on December 25 noted Kim Jong Il's life was the most brilliant one of a great revolutionary who explored a rugged untrodden path with iron will and superhuman energy, holding high the red flag of revolution and of a peerless patriot who devoted his all to the country and its people.
					
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, in his statement on December 26 said Kim Jong Il was an outstanding thinker and theoretician, a brilliant strategist and a prominent statesman in the present century.
					
					 The acting chairman of the Revolutionary Youth Union of Syria in a statement on the same day noted the youth and people of the DPRK would turn sorrow into strength and courage and steadily advance along the way indicated by Kim Jong Il in his lifetime and surely accomplish the national reunification and the cause of building a thriving nation under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 The mayor of Yangon City of Myanmar in a statement on December 27 lauded Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, conducted energetic activities for socialism, the cause of justice and the world peace and security and made a great contribution to the development of friendship, unity and cooperative ties between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The general director of the Ministry of Sports of Myanmar who doubles as the secretary general of its Olympic Committee noted in his statement on December 22 the ideas and exploits of Kim Jong Il will be immortal as the DPRK is under its supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: E European and Central Asian Regional Committee Releases Statement
articles.content:
E European and Central Asian Regional Committee Releases Statement

					  Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The East European and Central Asian Regional Committee for Mourning Comrade Kim Jong Il released a statement on December 25.
					
					 The statement said leader Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the cause of materializing the Juche idea, the Songun idea which considers independence and happiness of a human being, good faith, justice and self-reliance as an ideal.
					
					 The adherents to the Juche idea in East European and Central Asian regions will more positively conduct activities for studying and disseminating his works, the statement said, and continued:
					
					 It was one of the feats performed by Kim Jong Il that he clearly explained the reason why socialism collapsed in East European countries and indicated ways of beating back imperialism under new situation.
					
					 A vigorous struggle is now under way in various countries to frustrate the high-handed and arbitrary practices of the imperialists along the road of sovereignty and independence indicated by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will conduct brisk activities to widely propagate the ideological heritage of Kim Jong Il. We will organize diverse activities including lectures and seminars on his ideological and theoretical achievements as part of these activities.

articles.title: Organizations of Different Countries Issue Statements
articles.content:
Organizations of Different Countries Issue Statements

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries issued statements on Dec. 26 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The Association for the Study of Songun Politics in Mariupol City of Ukraine in a statement said that Kim Jong Il was a great master of ideas and theories and a guide of global independence.
					
					 The Belarusian Youth Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics Named after February 16 in a statement noted that Kim Jong Il was a genuine popular leader who devoted his whole life to the people's happiness and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of mankind for his undying feats performed for happiness of the Korean people and the world peace and security, the statements stressed.
					
					 The editorial board of the Russian newspaper Patriot said thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un the revolutionary history and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il will be brilliantly recorded in the history of world politics. 
					
					 The Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development lauded his undying feats.

articles.title: Organizations of Russia, Nepal, Switzerland Issue Statements
articles.content:
Organizations of Russia, Nepal, Switzerland Issue Statements

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Young Communist League of Russia, the Russian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Nepali Socialist Forum of Journalists issued statements on Dec. 24 and 26 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The C.C., Young Communist League of Russia in a statement said that the world progressives are overcome with pain and sorrow at the great loss--the demise of Kim Jong Il, the outstanding leader of the world socialist movement. 
					
					 The statement noted:
					
					 He visited again and again not only cities, rural areas and industrial complexes but small farm villages and devoted himself to happiness of the people till the last moment of his life, finding himself among workers, farmers and servicepersons wherever he went, the statement noted.
					
					 The heart of the bright star over Mt. Paektu stopped beating but it will always shed bright rays of revolution.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the Korean people will heroically overcome all difficulties even in sorrow, rallied closer around the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the great successor, and the Workers' Party of Korea, and continue advancing toward a bright future,
					
					 The Russian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung in a statement stressed that Kim Jong Il will always be remembered by the working masses as a symbol of true human being cherished in their  minds at all times.
					
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on Dec. 21 said that Kim Jong Il pursued the Songun politics, making a great contribution to shattering all the moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers for a war of aggression and defending the peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.

articles.title: Foreigners Issue Statements
articles.content:
Foreigners Issue Statements

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Bulgaria, Belarus and Austria issued statements on Dec. 27 over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In a joint statement the Communist Workers' Party of Belarus, the National Social Federation "For the Union and Union's Communist Party" of Belarus and the Permanent Committee of the Belarus-DPRK National Friend Association Named After Kim Il Sung said that Kim Jong Il defended the independence of the country with his unique correct Songun politics and performed distinguished feats for the world socialist movement.
					
					 The Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation in a statement said that Kim Jong Il had creditably carried forward the cause of Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Bulgarian Worker's Party (Communist) in its statement said that Kim Jong Il conducted energetic activities to protect global peace and security and develop the friendly relations among peoples and made immortal contributions to the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Ethiopian Organization Issues Bulletin
articles.content:
Ethiopian Organization Issues Bulletin

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea issued bulletin No. 31 on December 24 on the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The bulletin carried articles under various titles together with photos of Kim Jong Il receiving enthusiastic cheers from representatives of different countries of the world.
					
					 The bulletin noted in an article that Kim Jong Il enjoyed the undisputed trust not only from the Korean people but from the world people for his immortal exploits performed for the prosperity of the DPRK and global independence in his lifetime.
					
					 Although he passed away to everybody's regret, he will live forever in the hearts of the Korean people and world progressives, it noted.
					
					 It introduced his brief biography and cited detailed facts about his political caliber.

articles.title: Russian and US News Agencies on Korean People's Faith
articles.content:
Russian and US News Agencies on Korean People's Faith

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- Russian and U.S. news agencies introduced the servicepersons and people of the DPRK mourning the untimely passing of leader Kim Jong Il in grief and their faith to remain loyal to the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un on Dec. 21 and 24.
					
					 The Russian ITAR-TASS said that memorial events are taking place at the Kumsusan Memorial Palace where the bier of Kim Jong Il lies and before his portraits and mosaics showing his career and activities in the DPRK.
					
					 The news agency noted that the army and people of the DPRK grieved over the demise of Kim Jong Il due to the fatigue pent up in the course of ceaseless field guidance, adding that they are renewing their pledge to faithfully uphold Kim Jong Un, the only leader for them. 
					
					 It conveyed the accounts of reports released by the DPRK media that the cause of Kim Jong Il is sure to be carried forward and accomplished by Kim Jong Un, outstanding leader of the party and the army.
					
					 AP reported that the army and the people of the DPRK vowed in bitter tears to hold General Kim Jong Un in high esteem as their supreme commander.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Dec. 26 issue of Nepali newspaper Charcha                       carried an article contributed by its editor-in-chief on the demise of Kim Jong Il.

They were the Saratov Regional Committee of the Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party, the Saratov Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy and the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria.

					 The chief of the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader and tender-hearted father of the Korean people who had wisely guided the party, state and army for many years.

articles.title: Humankind Will Always Remember Immortal Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Humankind Will Always Remember Immortal Exploits of Kim Jong Il

					 Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association posted an article praising the immortal revolutionary exploits of leader Kim Jong Il on its Internet homepage on December 24 on the 20th anniversary of his assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th anniversary of birth of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The life of Kim Jong Il was the noble one dedicated to building a prosperous and powerful country, achieving national reunification and defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country, the article said, and continued:
					
					 Kim Jong Il held higher the banner of Songun under the unprecedentedly hard and difficult situation created due to the repeated natural disasters, the moves and sanctions of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK after the demise of President Kim Il Sung, a great loss to the nation.
					
					 True to the last instructions of the President, Kim Jong Il formulated the three charters for national reunification for realizing the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and provided north-south summits in Pyongyang in June 2000 and October 2007, making a great contribution to promoting reconciliation and peaceful reunification of the Korean nation.
					
					 He raised the international authority and position of the DPRK through his energetic external activities.
					
					 The Korean people and progressive humankind will always remember the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il with profound memory.
